      • overlaps

        public <Z extends Zone> boolean overlaps(Z zone)
        This should DEFINITELY be overridden! It is a basic attempt at a check. That is all.

        Unless this is overridden it treats the zone as a circle around the location.

        Type Parameters:
        Z - Something extending Zone
        Parameters:
        zone - The zone to check against
        Returns:
        boo

      • getWeight

      • getRadius

        public abstract double getRadius()
        This method should return the LARGEST POSSIBLE radius from the point in getLocation(). It is used in narrowing checks, so any point within your zone MUST fall within this radius.

        What this means is that if your zone is a strange shape, such as a giant 3D pentagram, this radius must be at least the distance from the getLocation() to the furthest covered point.

        This is used as a fast check to see if a position might fall within your zone, before the actual isInside(Location) method is called. If your zone is a super-complex shape and the inside check has massive overhead, we wouldn't want to be calling that needlessly.

        You should therefore over-estimate this, just in case.

        Returns:
        The over-estimated radius

      • isInside

        public abstract boolean isInside(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull Location location)
        Whether a location falls inside your zone type. For simple (cuboidal) zones, this might be as simple as checking whether it is in bounds, or whether it is within a radius (spherical) - but your zone might be more complex. Here is where you should perform your checks.

        When this is called, it is already known that: • Location exists • Location is in the same world as getWorld() • Location falls within a distance of getRadius() around getLocation()

        Parameters:
        location - The location to test
        Returns:
        boo

      • canInteract

        public boolean canInteract(@NotNull
                           @NotNull Location location,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull String interactionType)
        Whether an interaction can occur. This sort of interaction is one without a player cause, such as a creeper exploding or a block decaying.

        This will be called after isInside(Location) is checked.

        Feel free to override this if you have a more special check.

        Parameters:
        location - The location
        interactionType - The interaction type
        Returns:
        boo

      • canInteract

        public boolean canInteract(@NotNull
                           @NotNull Location location,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull String interactionType,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull Player player)
        Whether a player-caused interaction can occur. Interactions not directly caused by players will be covered by canInteract(Location, String).

        This will be called after isInside(Location) is checked.

        Feel free to override this if you have a more special check.

        Parameters:
        location - The location
        interactionType - The interaction type
        player - The interacting player
        Returns:
        boo

      • canEdit

        public abstract boolean canEdit(@NotNull
                                @NotNull UUID player)
        This method should be used for proverbial 'owners' of the zone. It will be used when a player tries to alter flags or delete the zone.

        This is also used when checking whether a player can create a zone intersecting existing zones.

        Parameters:
        player - The UUID of the potential editor
        Returns:
        Whether this player can make changes to the zone (i.e. flags, etc.)

      • getBlocks

        @NotNull
public abstract @NotNull List<Block> getBlocks()
        This should return any block that is protected/covered by the zone.
        Returns:
        the covered blocks

      • getBoundingBox

        @NotNull
public abstract @NotNull BoundingBox getBoundingBox()
        This should return a bounding box encompassing the entirety of the zone. It should be a cuboidal approximation of the zone (i.e. the same max width/height) and will be used for preliminary area checks.
        Returns:
        A bounding box

      • getChunks

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Chunk[] getChunks()
        Returns:
        The list of chunks that this zone crosses or occupies
